name: Arrows
desc: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

name: Backpack
desc: A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)
desc: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Thieves' Tools
desc: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

name: Alchemist's Supplies
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Alchemist's supplies allow you to identify substances (DC 15) or start a fire (DC 15). You can craft Acid, Alchemist's Fire, Component Pouch, Oil, Paper, and Perfume.

name: Brewer's Supplies
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Brewer's supplies allow you to detect poisoned drink (DC 15) or identify alcohol (DC 10). You can craft Antitoxin.

name: Calligrapher's Supplies
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Calligrapher's supplies allow you to write text with impressive flourishes that guard against forgery (DC 15). You can craft Ink and Spell Scrolls.

name: Carpenter's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Carpenter's tools allow you to seal or pry open a door or container (DC 20). You can craft Club, Greatclub, Quarterstaff, Barrel, Chest, Ladder, Pole, Portable Ram, and Torch.

name: Cartographer's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Cartographer's tools allow you to draft a map of a small area (DC 15). You can craft Maps.

name: Cobbler's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Cobbler's tools allow you to modify footwear to give Advantage on the wearer's next Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (DC 10). You can craft Climber's Kit.

name: Cook's Utensils
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Cook's utensils allow you to improve the flavor of food (DC 10). You can craft Rations.

name: Glassblower's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Glassblower's tools allow you to discern what a glass object held in the past 24 hours (DC 15). You can craft Glass Bottle, Magnifying Glass, Spyglass, and Vial.

name: Jeweler's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Jeweler's tools allow you to discern a gem's value (DC 15). You can craft Arcane Focus and Holy Symbol.

name: Leatherworker's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Leatherworker's tools allow you to add a design to a leather item (DC 10). You can craft Sling, Whip, Hide Armor, Leather Armor, Studded Leather Armor, Backpack, Crossbow Bolt Case, Map or Scroll Case, and Quiver.

name: Mason's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Mason's tools allow you to chisel a symbol or hole in stone (DC 10). You can craft Block and Tackle.

name: Painter's Supplies
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Painter's supplies allow you to paint a recognizable image of something you've seen (DC 10). You can craft Druidic Focus and Holy Symbol.

name: Potter's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Potter's tools allow you to discern what a ceramic object held in the past 24 hours (DC 15). You can craft Jug and Lamp.

name: Smith's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Smith's tools allow you to pry open a door or container (DC 20). You can craft metal weapons and armor.

name: Tinker's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Tinker's tools allow you to assemble a Tiny item composed of scrap, which falls apart in 1 minute (DC 20). You can craft Musket, Pistol, Bell, Bullseye Lantern, Flask, Hooded Lantern, Lock, Manacles, Mirror, Net, Spyglass, and Tinderbox.

name: Navigator's Tools
desc: Navigator's tools allow you to plot a course (DC 10) or determine position by stargazing (DC 15). Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to avoid getting lost at sea.

name: Weaver's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Weaver's tools allow you to mend a tear in clothing (DC 10) or sew a Tiny design (DC 10). You can craft textiles and clothing.

name: Woodcarver's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Woodcarver's tools allow you to carve a pattern in wood (DC 10). You can craft Club, Greatclub, Quarterstaff, Ranged weapons (except Pistol, Musket, and Sling), Arcane Focus, Arrows, Bolts, Druidic Focus, Ink Pen, and Needles.

name: Lute
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Bagpipes
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Drum
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Dulcimer
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Flute
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Horn
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Lyre
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Pan Flute
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Shawm
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Viol
desc: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. You can play a known tune (DC 10) or improvise a song (DC 15).

name: Crystal
desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

name: Potion of Healing
desc: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

name: Torch
desc: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

name: Bedroll
desc: A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket.

name: Acid
desc: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a vial of Acid. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d6 Acid damage.

name: Alchemist's Fire
desc: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Alchemist's Fire. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take 1d4 Fire damage and start burning.

name: Antitoxin
desc: As a Bonus Action, you can drink a vial of Antitoxin to gain Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

name: Orb
desc: An Arcane Focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

name: Rod
desc: An Arcane Focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

name: Staff
desc: An Arcane Focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus. This staff also functions as a quarterstaff.

name: Wand
desc: An Arcane Focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

name: Ball Bearings
desc: As a Utilize action, you can spill Ball Bearings from their pouch. They spread to cover a level, 10-foot-square area within 10 feet of yourself. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or have the Prone condition. It takes 10 minutes to recover the Ball Bearings.

name: Barrel
desc: A Barrel holds up to 40 gallons of liquid or up to 4 cubic feet of dry goods.

name: Basket
desc: A Basket holds up to 40 pounds within 2 cubic feet.

name: Bell
desc: When rung as a Utilize action, a Bell produces a sound that can be heard up to 60 feet away.

name: Blanket
desc: While wrapped in a blanket, you have Advantage on saving throws against extreme cold.

name: Block and Tackle
desc: A Block and Tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

name: Book
desc: A Book contains fiction or nonfiction. If you consult an accurate nonfiction Book about its topic, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence (Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion) checks you make about that topic.

name: Bottle, Glass
desc: A Glass Bottle holds up to 1Â½ pints.

name: Bucket
desc: A Bucket holds up to half a cubic foot of contents.

name: Caltrops
desc: As a Utilize action, you can spread Caltrops from their bag to cover a 5-foot-square area within 5 feet of yourself. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 1 Piercing damage and have its Speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. It takes 10 minutes to recover the Caltrops.

name: Candle
desc: For 1 hour, a lit Candle sheds Bright Light in a 5-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 5 feet.

name: Case, Crossbow Bolt
desc: A Crossbow Bolt Case holds up to 20 Bolts.

name: Case, Map or Scroll
desc: A Map or Scroll Case holds up to 10 sheets of paper or 5 sheets of parchment.

name: Chain
desc: As a Utilize action, you can wrap a Chain around an unwilling creature within 5 feet of yourself that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition if you succeed on a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check. If the creature's legs are bound, the creature has the Restrained condition until it escapes. Escaping the Chain requires the creature to make a successful DC 18 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check as an action. Bursting the Chain requires a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action.

name: Chest
desc: A Chest holds up to 12 cubic feet of contents.

name: Climber's Kit
desc: A Climber's Kit includes boot tips, gloves, pitons, and a harness. As a Utilize action, you can use the Climber's Kit to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the anchor point, and you can't move more than 25 feet from there without undoing the anchor as a Bonus Action.

name: Clothes, Fine
desc: Fine Clothes are made of expensive fabrics and adorned with expertly crafted details. Some events and locations admit only people wearing these clothes.

name: Clothes, Traveler's
desc: Traveler's Clothes are resilient garments designed for travel in various environments.

name: Component Pouch
desc: A Component Pouch is watertight and filled with compartments that hold all the free Material components of your spells.

name: Costume
desc: While wearing a Costume, you have Advantage on any ability check you make to impersonate the person or type of person it represents.

name: Crowbar
desc: Using a Crowbar gives you Advantage on Strength checks where the Crowbar's leverage can be applied.

name: Flask
desc: A Flask holds up to 1 pint.

name: Grappling Hook
desc: As a Utilize action, you can throw the Grappling Hook at a railing, a ledge, or another catch within 50 feet of yourself, and the hook catches on if you succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. If you tied a Rope to the hook, you can then climb it.

name: Healer's Kit
desc: A Healer's Kit has ten uses. As a Utilize action, you can expend one of its uses to stabilize an Unconscious creature that has 0 Hit Points without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

name: Holy Water
desc: As a Utilize action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of yourself or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an improvised weapon. If the target is a Fiend or an Undead, it takes 2d6 Radiant damage. A Cleric or Paladin may create holy water by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

name: Hunting Trap
desc: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

name: Ink Pen
desc: An ink pen is used to write with ink.

name: Ink
desc: A bottle of ink contains enough ink to write for approximately 50 pages.

name: Jug
desc: A jug holds up to 1 gallon.

name: Ladder
desc: A ladder can be used to climb to higher places.

name: Lamp
desc: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lantern, Bullseye
desc: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lantern, Hooded
desc: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

name: Lock
desc: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your GM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

name: Magnifying Glass
desc: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

name: Manacles
desc: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

name: Map
desc: A map shows the layout of an area.

name: Mirror
desc: A steel mirror is useful for looking around corners or signaling with reflected sunlight.

name: Net
desc: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net.

name: Oil
desc: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

name: Paper
desc: One sheet of paper.

name: Parchment
desc: One sheet of parchment.

name: Perfume
desc: A vial of perfume or cologne.

name: Poison, Basic
desc: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

name: Pole
desc: A 10-foot pole. Useful for probing ahead in dungeons.

name: Pot, Iron
desc: An iron pot suitable for cooking.

name: Pouch
desc: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch.

name: Quiver
desc: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

name: Ram, Portable
desc: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

name: Rations
desc: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

name: Robe
desc: A robe.

name: Rope, Silk (50 feet)
desc: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Sack
desc: A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

name: Shovel
desc: A shovel for digging.

name: Signal Whistle
desc: A whistle can be heard up to 300 feet away.

name: Spikes, Iron
desc: A pack of 10 iron spikes.

name: Spyglass
desc: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

name: String
desc: 10 feet of string.

name: Tent
desc: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

name: Tinderbox
desc: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torchâor anything else with abundant, exposed fuelâtakes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

name: Vial
desc: A small glass container that holds 4 ounces of liquid.

name: Waterskin
desc: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

name: Burglar's Pack
desc: A Burglar's Pack contains the following items: Backpack, Ball Bearings, Bell, 10 Candles, Crowbar, Hooded Lantern, 7 flasks of Oil, 5 days of Rations, Rope, Tinderbox, and Waterskin.

name: Diplomat's Pack
desc: A Diplomat's Pack contains the following items: Chest, Fine Clothes, Ink, 5 Ink Pens, Lamp, 2 Map or Scroll Cases, 4 flasks of Oil, 5 sheets of Paper, 5 sheets of Parchment, Perfume, and Tinderbox.

name: Dungeoneer's Pack
desc: A Dungeoneer's Pack contains the following items: Backpack, Caltrops, Crowbar, 2 flasks of Oil, 10 days of Rations, Rope, Tinderbox, 10 Torches, and Waterskin.

name: Entertainer's Pack
desc: An Entertainer's Pack contains the following items: Backpack, Bedroll, Costume, 2 Candles, Disguise Kit, 5 days of Rations, Waterskin, and a musical instrument of your choice.

name: Explorer's Pack
desc: An Explorer's Pack contains the following items: Backpack, Bedroll, 2 flasks of Oil, 10 days of Rations, Rope, Tinderbox, 10 Torches, and Waterskin.

name: Priest's Pack
desc: A Priest's Pack contains the following items: Backpack, Blanket, Holy Water, Lamp, 7 days of Rations, Robe, and Tinderbox.

name: Scholar's Pack
desc: A Scholar's Pack contains the following items: Backpack, Book, Ink, Ink Pen, Lamp, 10 flasks of Oil, 10 sheets of Parchment, and Tinderbox.

name: Camel
desc: A beast of burden adapted for desert travel. Camels can carry heavy loads and travel long distances without water.

name: Elephant
desc: A massive pachyderm capable of carrying enormous loads. Elephants are intelligent and can be trained for various tasks.

name: Horse, Draft
desc: A large, sturdy horse bred for heavy work such as pulling carts and plowing fields. Not suitable for riding into battle.

name: Horse, Riding
desc: A horse trained for riding. Riding horses are bred for speed and endurance, making them excellent for travel and light combat.

name: Mastiff
desc: A large, powerful dog bred for guarding and hunting. Mastiffs are loyal and can be trained for various tasks including combat support.

name: Mule
desc: A hybrid animal produced by crossing a horse and a donkey. Mules are sure-footed and excellent for carrying loads over rough terrain.

name: Pony
desc: A small horse, typically under 14.2 hands high. Ponies are hardy and sure-footed, making them suitable for smaller riders or rough terrain.

name: Warhorse
desc: A large horse trained for battle. Warhorses are bred for strength, speed, and courage, making them formidable allies in combat.

name: Carriage
desc: A four-wheeled vehicle designed for passenger transport. Requires a draft animal to pull it.

name: Cart
desc: A simple two-wheeled vehicle for transporting goods. Requires a draft animal to pull it.

name: Chariot
desc: A two-wheeled vehicle pulled by horses, often used for racing or warfare. Requires trained horses to pull it effectively.

name: Sled
desc: A vehicle designed for travel over snow and ice. Requires a draft animal to pull it.

name: Wagon
desc: A four-wheeled vehicle designed for transporting goods and passengers. Requires a draft animal to pull it.

name: Galley
desc: A large warship propelled by oars and sails. Galleys are fast and maneuverable, making them ideal for naval combat.

name: Keelboat
desc: A riverboat with a shallow draft, suitable for inland waterways. Keelboats are used for transporting goods and passengers on rivers and lakes.

name: Longship
desc: A swift vessel propelled by oars and a single sail. Longships are used for raiding and exploration, capable of both river and sea travel.

name: Rowboat
desc: A small boat propelled by oars. Rowboats can be carried overland and are useful for crossing rivers and lakes.

name: Sailing Ship
desc: A large vessel propelled by sails. Sailing ships are used for long-distance travel and trade across oceans and seas.

name: Warship
desc: A heavily armed sailing vessel designed for naval combat. Warships are equipped with ballistas and other siege weapons.

name: Exotic Saddle
desc: A saddle comes with a bit, a bridle, reins, and any other equipment needed to use the saddle. An Exotic Saddle is required for riding an aquatic or a flying mount.

name: Military Saddle
desc: A saddle comes with a bit, a bridle, reins, and any other equipment needed to use the saddle. A Military Saddle gives Advantage on any ability check you make to remain mounted.

name: Riding Saddle
desc: A saddle comes with a bit, a bridle, reins, and any other equipment needed to use the saddle. A Riding Saddle is the standard saddle for most mounts.

name: Feed (per day)
desc: Daily feed for a mount or beast of burden. This includes hay, grain, and other necessary nutrition for one day.

name: Stabling (per day)
desc: Daily cost for housing a mount in a stable, including care, grooming, and basic feed.
